blocks.text: Source: ACR O-RADS MRI Risk Score Assessment and Management (PDF).

items: Applies to adnexal (ovarian/tubal) masses in non-pregnant patients; score 1-5 reflects malignancy risk and guides management.
Score is driven by morphology, presence and behavior of enhancing solid tissue, DWI signal, and time-intensity curve (TIC) relative to outer myometrium.
Typical benign descriptors (score 2) override higher scores; physiologic findings are score 1.
DWI: high if solid tissue signal is > endometrium on high b-value (>=800) and shows low ADC; low if <= myometrium with no ADC restriction.
TIC (solid tissue vs outer myometrium): Type 1 progressive; Type 2 plateau; Type 3 washout (faster than myometrium).
Solid tissue includes papillary projections, mural nodules, septations >=3 mm that enhance, or other enhancing soft tissue components.

blocks.text: Risk categories, PPV bands, and management.
If present, classify as score 2 regardless of TIC/DWI.
Assign score for masses with enhancing solid tissue (papillae, mural nodules, septa >=3 mm).

TIC reference: compare to outer myometrium. High DWI: b>=800 signal > endometrium with corresponding low ADC. Low DWI: <= myometrium and no low ADC. Solid tissue includes papillary projections, mural nodules, septa >=3 mm, or other enhancing components.
Use morphology to capture classic benign lesions; otherwise score solid tissue with TIC and DWI, then manage per O-RADS MRI 1-5.

items: Describe lesion type (cystic, multilocular, solid), solid tissue components, TIC type, and DWI/ADC behavior.
State O-RADS MRI score and rationale (classic benign descriptor, TIC/DWI combination, or ancillary malignant features).
Recommend management per score and note if gynecologic oncology consultation is advised (scores 4-5).

blocks.text: ACR O-RADS MRI Risk Score Assessment and Management. PDF: link.
